stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the entire stream prototyping the new theme for Course 11: an oil-rig / air-ship facility tentatively called “Frantic Fleet Factory.”  He experiments with stylised ‘ocean spire’ mountains, rough-blocks major set-pieces (Bowser statue, crane, landing pad) and outlines mission flow.

development_findings.summary: Course 11’s original volcano idea has been scrapped in favour of a Bowser-owned oil-rig where airships are built and launched.
development_findings.quote: “Right, so the whole volcano theme is gone now – we want it to be something like this.”

development_findings.summary: Working title for the level is “Frantic Fleet Factory”; Kaze insists every stage name use rhyme or alliteration.
development_findings.quote: “All names in this game are cool alterations… Frantic Fleet Factory is the current name I’m thinking of.”

development_findings.summary: Mission structure sketched: 1) disrupt workers on the rig, 2) strike scenario where Mario climbs a crane to decapitate a giant Bowser statue, 3-5) additional sub-areas, 6) underwater 8-bit pipe.
Central Bowser statue will sit on a spire, oil pouring from its mouth; access to the crane is blocked by Thwomps until mission 2.
development_findings.quote: “During mission one the Thwomps block you, during mission two they just let you go into the crane.”

development_findings.summary: Key asset list drafted: cranes, hooks, seesaw platforms, shipping containers, zip-lines, oil-spill hazards, jumping Podoboos, cannons inside buildings, thermal power plant pieces.
Long modelling session tests multiple ‘ocean spire’ styles inspired by New SMB and Mario World; goal is readable gameplay surfaces while keeping poly-count reasonable.
development_findings.quote: “If you make a mountain like this, it never feels like Mario is supposed to stand on anything… we have to experiment.”

development_findings.summary: Textures and lighting still provisional; vertex colours will be added and rock textures swapped to achieve a cohesive Mario style.
Global coin-count HUD feature exists but is not yet initialised in current build.
development_findings.quote: “It’s a feature that’s not implemented yet… it doesn’t initialise right now.”

development_findings.summary: Kaze muses about using a hypothetical 16 MB RAM expansion to decode MP3s at load-time, trading ROM size for loading delays.
development_findings.quote: “If you had 16 megabytes we could put MP3s instead of WAV and decode them during load time… although that would cause really long load times.”

development_findings.summary: Multi-language support is planned; community member Rionu has volunteered to translate.
development_findings.quote: “There’s this really annoying guy called Rionu and he says he’s going to translate.”

context_findings.summary: Kaze, age 27, feels modern games give him less genuine freedom and admits he ‘hyper-analyses everything.’
context_findings.quote: “Maybe freedom in games just doesn’t exist… I’m hyper-analysing fucking everything.”

context_findings.summary: He avoids playing other games on stream because it prevents him from focusing and enjoying the moment.
context_findings.quote: “When I play a game on stream I don’t feel like I can actually just focus on the moment.”

context_findings.summary: Shows marketing awareness, warning another hacker that releasing a ROM hack a week after Tears of the Kingdom is risky both for attention and Nintendo DMCA action.
context_findings.quote: “That’s dangerous marketing-wise… Nintendo also has a habit of going after ROM hacks right after they release their own games.”

context_findings.summary: Personal note: he and Zeina built a closed-jar terrarium the previous day – a glimpse of their off-screen life.
context_findings.quote: “Me and Zeina went out and we made a terrarium in a closed jar.”

zeina.summary: End-game cut-scene is on hold until Zeina finishes the required animations.
zeina.quote: “I still also need to do the end cutscene, but I was waiting for the animations from Zeina first.”

zeina.summary: Kaze mentions spending personal time with Zeina creating a terrarium, hinting at healthy work-life balance.

key_stories.title: Theme Pivot to Oil Rig
key_stories.summary: Course 11 was originally a volcano but Kaze decided it clashed with the wider game.  He re-imagined it as Bowser’s industrial oil-rig where airships launch.
key_stories.challenge: Volcano setting felt thematically weak and limited platform ideas.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed alternatives with chat, gathered reference images, sketched layout, renamed level.
key_stories.outcome: New direction (‘Frantic Fleet Factory’) with clear visual identity and mission structure.
key_stories.key_quote: “The whole volcano theme is gone now – we switched to the oil rig theming.”

key_stories.title: Crane Strike & Bowser Statue
key_stories.summary: A signature mission has Mario commandeer a tall crane during a workers’ strike to behead a giant oil-spewing Bowser statue.
key_stories.challenge: Need a memorable objective that changes between missions and leverages vertical space.
key_stories.process: Placed statue at centre, planned Thwomp gates, designed thin internal crane climb.
key_stories.outcome: Mission 2 now offers tight vertical platforming and a dynamic environmental change.
key_stories.key_quote: “With the crane you just behead him and get the star.”

key_stories.title: Reworking Course 1 Star Path
key_stories.summary: Prompted by Lilaa, Kaze revisits the first star, adding verticality via a tree, plant launcher, and relocated windmill.
key_stories.challenge: Original path was too short and flat.
key_stories.process: Mapped new route that teaches mechanics (spin plants) and tours the level.
key_stories.outcome: More engaging intro star; reflects Kaze’s willingness to iterate even late in development.
key_stories.key_quote: “Here we go again, but look – the star kind of just takes you around the whole level with a lot of vertical platforming.”
